bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 20, 1929

div1.p: Kean sends Emilie Lawrence Reed a copy of the new Secretary of War's speech, given at West Point.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 20, 1929

opener.dateline:
THE MILITARY SURGEON
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM
WASHINGTON June 20
1929

div1.p:
Your very prompt and
delightful letter gave me
great pleasure and I feel
encouraged to ask you other
impertinent questions in order
to get such nice answers -
but I wont - your reward
is inclosed however in a
copy of the address of the
new Secy of War at West Point
which speaks beautifully in
two places of your famous hus-
band - General McCoy sends
it to you- He called me up to
get your address and I asked
him to send it through me so
that I could see and enjoy it
too- So he is the one to acknowl-
edge it to - his address is:
Brig- Gen. Frank R. McCoy USA
1718 H H. n.w. Washington, D.C.
I was pleased to send the Secy's
reference to him as well as
to his and my old chief- Gen.
Wood-

The season in the garden with
you is much behind us- Our
pillar rose & ramblers all were
over ten days ago & the Silver moon
even earlier - I have nothing in
bloom now but hollyhocks and
petunias and an occasional
radiance rose -

Give my love to Blossom - If
we get a chance we will
certainly run up to see you
some nice day -
div1.closer: Affectionately your friend J. R. Kean Thanks for the violet-
